meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly placing or arranging something.
meanings.sent1: Her misspacing of the books on the shelf caused them to fall.
meanings.sent2: The misspacing of the furniture made the room look cluttered.
meanings.sent3: The misspacing of the ingredients in the recipe led to a funny tasting dish.
meanings.sent4: His misspacing of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent5: The misspacing of the road signs confused the drivers.

meanings.definition: To place or arrange something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: Please avoid misspacing the chairs in the meeting room.
meanings.sent2: She kept misspacing the words in her essay.
meanings.sent3: He misspaced the buttons on his shirt, making it look mismatched.
meanings.sent4: The artist intentionally misspaced the colors in the painting for effect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener accidentally misspaced the flowers in the garden bed.

meanings.sent1: The misspacing of the labels on the boxes caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the misspacing of the chairs in the waiting area.
meanings.sent3: The misspacing of the pictures on the wall made the room look odd.
meanings.sent4: The misspacing of the keys on the keyboard slowed down his typing.
meanings.sent5: Her misspacing of the items on the grocery list led to missing ingredients.
